Theory Set_Multiplication

(*
    File:     Set_Multiplication.thy
    Author:   Joseph Thommes, TU MÃ¼nchen
*)
section â€¹Set Multiplicationâ€º

theory Set_Multiplication
  imports "HOL-Algebra.Algebra"
begin

text â€¹This theory/section is of auxiliary nature and is mainly used to establish a connection
between the set multiplication and the multiplication of subgroups via the â€¹IDirProdâ€º (although this
particular notion is introduced later). However, as in every section of this entry, there are some
lemmas that do not have any further usage in this entry, but are of interest just by themselves.â€º

lemma (in group) set_mult_union:
  "A <#> (B âˆª C) = (A <#> B) âˆª (A <#> C)"
  unfolding set_mult_def by auto

lemma (in group) set_mult_card_single_el_eq:
  assumes "J âŠ† carrier G" "x âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "card (l_coset G x J) = card J" unfolding l_coset_def
proof -
  have "card ((âŠ—) x ` J) = card J"
    using inj_on_cmult[of x] card_image[of "(âŠ—) x" J] assms inj_on_subset[of "(âŠ—) x" "carrier G" J]
    by blast
  moreover have "(â‹ƒyâˆˆJ. {x âŠ— y}) = (âŠ—) x ` J" using image_def[of "(âŠ—) x" J] by blast
  ultimately show "card (â‹ƒhâˆˆJ. {x âŠ— h}) = card J" by presburger
qed

text â€¹We find an upper bound for the cardinality of a set product.â€º

lemma (in group) set_mult_card_le:
  assumes "finite H" "H âŠ† carrier G" "J âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "card (H <#> J) â‰¤ card H * card J"
  using assms
proof (induction "card H" arbitrary: H)
  case 0
  then have "H = {}" by force
  then show ?case using set_mult_def[of G H J] by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then obtain a where a_def: "a âˆˆ H" by fastforce
  then have c_n: "card (H - {a}) = n" using Suc by force
  then have "card ((H - {a}) <#> J) â‰¤ card (H - {a}) * card J" using Suc by blast
  moreover have "card ({a} <#> J) = card J"
    using Suc(4, 5) a_def set_mult_card_single_el_eq[of J a] l_coset_eq_set_mult[of G a J] by auto
  moreover have "H <#> J = (H - {a} <#> J) âˆª ({a} <#> J)" using set_mult_def[of G _ J] a_def by auto
  moreover have "card (H - {a}) * card J + card J = Suc n * card J" using c_n mult_Suc by presburger
  ultimately show ?case using card_Un_le[of "H - {a} <#> J" "{a} <#> J"] c_n â€¹Suc n = card Hâ€º by auto
qed

lemma (in group) set_mult_finite:
  assumes "finite H" "finite J" "H âŠ† carrier G" "J âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "finite (H <#> J)"
  using assms set_mult_def[of G H J] by auto

text â€¹The next lemma allows us to later to derive that two finite subgroups $J$ and $H$ are complementary
if and only if their product has the cardinality $|J| \cdot |H|$.â€º

lemma (in group) set_mult_card_eq_impl_empty_inter:
  assumes "finite H" "finite J" "H âŠ† carrier G" "J âŠ† carrier G" "card (H <#> J) = card H * card J"
  shows "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ H; b âˆˆ H; a â‰  bâŸ§ âŸ¹ ((âŠ—) a ` J) âˆ© ((âŠ—) b ` J) = {}"
  using assms
proof (induction H rule: finite_induct)
  case empty
  then show ?case by fast
next
  case step: (insert x H)
  from step have x_c: "x âˆˆ carrier G" by simp
  from step have H_c: "H âŠ† carrier G" by simp
  from set_mult_card_single_el_eq[of J x] have card_x: "card ({x} <#> J) = card J"
    using â€¹J âŠ† carrier Gâ€º x_c l_coset_eq_set_mult by metis
  moreover have ins: "(insert x H) <#> J = (H <#> J) âˆª ({x} <#> J)"
    using set_mult_def[of G _ J] by auto
  ultimately have "card (H <#> J) â‰¥ card H * card J"
    using card_Un_le[of "H <#> J" "{x} <#> J"] â€¹card (insert x H <#> J) = card (insert x H) * card Jâ€º
    by (simp add: step.hyps(1) step.hyps(2))
  then have card_eq:"card (H <#> J) = card H * card J"
    using set_mult_card_le[of H J] step H_c by linarith
  then have ih: "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ H; b âˆˆ H; a â‰  bâŸ§ âŸ¹ ((âŠ—) a ` J) âˆ© ((âŠ—) b ` J) = {}"
    using step H_c by presburger

  have "card (insert x H) * card J = card H * card J + card J" using â€¹x âˆ‰ Hâ€º using step by simp
  then have "({x} <#> J) âˆ© (H <#> J) = {}"
    using card_eq card_x ins card_Un_Int[of "H <#> J" "{x} <#> J"] step set_mult_finite by auto
  then have "â‹€a. a âˆˆ H âŸ¹ (â‹ƒyâˆˆJ. {a âŠ— y}) âˆ© (â‹ƒyâˆˆJ. {x âŠ— y}) = {}" 
    using set_mult_def[of G _ J] by blast
  then have "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ (insert x H); b âˆˆ (insert x H); a â‰  bâŸ§ âŸ¹ ((âŠ—) a ` J) âˆ© ((âŠ—) b ` J) = {}"
    using â€¹x âˆ‰ Hâ€º ih by blast
  then show ?case using step by algebra
qed

lemma (in group) set_mult_card_eq_impl_empty_inter':
  assumes "finite H" "finite J" "H âŠ† carrier G" "J âŠ† carrier G" "card (H <#> J) = card H * card J"
  shows "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ H; b âˆˆ H; a â‰  bâŸ§ âŸ¹ (l_coset G a J) âˆ© (l_coset G b J) = {}"
  unfolding l_coset_def
  using set_mult_card_eq_impl_empty_inter image_def[of "(âŠ—) _" J] assms by blast

lemma (in comm_group) set_mult_comm:
  assumes "H âŠ† carrier G" "J âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "(H <#> J) = (J <#> H)"
  unfolding set_mult_def
proof -
  have 1: "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ carrier G; b âˆˆ carrier GâŸ§ âŸ¹ {a âŠ— b} = {b âŠ— a}" using m_comm by simp
  then have "â‹€a b.âŸ¦a âˆˆ H; b âˆˆ JâŸ§ âŸ¹ {a âŠ— b} = {b âŠ— a}" using assms by auto
  moreover have "â‹€a b.âŸ¦b âˆˆ H; a âˆˆ JâŸ§ âŸ¹ {a âŠ— b} = {b âŠ— a}" using assms 1 by auto
  ultimately show "(â‹ƒhâˆˆH. â‹ƒkâˆˆJ. {h âŠ— k}) = (â‹ƒkâˆˆJ. â‹ƒhâˆˆH. {k âŠ— h})"  by fast
qed

lemma (in group) set_mult_one_imp_inc:
  assumes "ğŸ­ âˆˆ A" "A âŠ† carrier G" "B âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "B âŠ† (B <#> A)"
proof
  fix x
  assume "x âˆˆ B"
  thus "x âˆˆ (B <#> A)" using assms unfolding set_mult_def by force
qed

text â€¹In all cases, we know that the product of two sets is always contained in the subgroup
generated by them.â€º
lemma (in group) set_mult_subset_generate:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "B âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "A <#> B âŠ† generate G (A âˆª B)"
proof
  fix x
  assume "x âˆˆ A <#> B"
  then obtain a b where ab: "a âˆˆ A" "b âˆˆ B" "x = a âŠ— b" unfolding set_mult_def by blast
  then have "a âˆˆ generate G (A âˆª B)" "b âˆˆ generate G (A âˆª B)"
    using generate.incl[of _ "A âˆª B" G] by simp+
  thus "x âˆˆ generate G (A âˆª B)" using ab generate.eng by metis
qed

text â€¹In the case of subgroups, the set product is just the subgroup generated by both
of the subgroups.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) set_mult_eq_generate_subgroup:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G"
  shows "generate G (H âˆª J) = H <#> J" (is "?L = ?R")
proof
  show "?L âŠ† ?R"
  proof
    fix x
    assume "x âˆˆ ?L"
    then show "x âˆˆ ?R"
    proof(induction rule: generate.induct)
      case one
      have "ğŸ­ âŠ— ğŸ­ = ğŸ­" using nat_pow_one[of 2] by simp
      thus ?case
        using assms subgroup.one_closed[OF assms(1)]
              subgroup.one_closed[OF assms(2)] set_mult_def[of G H J] by fastforce
    next
      case (incl x)
      have H1: "ğŸ­ âˆˆ H" using assms subgroup.one_closed by auto
      have J1: "ğŸ­ âˆˆ J" using assms subgroup.one_closed by auto
      have lx: "x âŠ— ğŸ­ = x" using r_one[of x] incl subgroup.subset assms by blast
      have rx: "ğŸ­ âŠ— x = x" using l_one[of x] incl subgroup.subset assms by blast
      show ?case
      proof (cases "x âˆˆ H")
        case True
        then show ?thesis using set_mult_def J1 lx by fastforce
      next
        case False
        then show ?thesis using set_mult_def H1 rx incl by fastforce
      qed
    next
      case (inv h)
      then have inv_in:"(inv h) âˆˆ H âˆª J" (is "?iv âˆˆ H âˆª J")
        using assms subgroup.m_inv_closed[of _ G h] by (cases "h âˆˆ H"; blast)
      have H1: "ğŸ­ âˆˆ H" using assms subgroup.one_closed by auto
      have J1: "ğŸ­ âˆˆ J" using assms subgroup.one_closed by auto
      have lx: "?iv âŠ— ğŸ­ = ?iv" using r_one[of "?iv"] subgroup.subset inv_in assms by blast
      have rx: "ğŸ­ âŠ— ?iv = ?iv" using l_one[of "?iv"] incl subgroup.subset inv_in assms by blast
      show ?case 
      proof (cases "?iv âˆˆ H")
        case True
        then show ?thesis using set_mult_def[of G H J] J1 lx by fastforce
      next
        case False
        then show ?thesis using set_mult_def[of G H J] H1 rx inv_in by fastforce
      qed
    next
      case (eng h g)
      from eng(3) obtain a b where aH: "a âˆˆ H" and bJ: "b âˆˆ J" and h_def: "h = a âŠ— b"
        using set_mult_def[of G H J] by fast
      have a_carr: "a âˆˆ carrier G" by (metis subgroup.mem_carrier assms(1) aH)
      have b_carr: "b âˆˆ carrier G" by (metis subgroup.mem_carrier assms(2) bJ)
      from eng(4) obtain c d where cH: "c âˆˆ H" and dJ: "d âˆˆ J" and g_def: "g = c âŠ— d"
        using set_mult_def[of G H J] by fast
      have c_carr: "c âˆˆ carrier G" by (metis subgroup.mem_carrier assms(1) cH)
      have d_carr: "d âˆˆ carrier G" by (metis subgroup.mem_carrier assms(2) dJ)
      then have "h âŠ— g = (a âŠ— c) âŠ— (b âŠ— d)"
        using a_carr b_carr c_carr d_carr g_def h_def m_assoc m_comm by force
      moreover have "a âŠ— c âˆˆ H" using assms(1) aH cH subgroup.m_closed by fast
      moreover have "b âŠ— d âˆˆ J" using assms(2) bJ dJ subgroup.m_closed by fast
      ultimately show ?case using set_mult_def by fast
    qed
  qed
next
  show "?R âŠ† ?L" using set_mult_subset_generate[of H J] subgroup.subset assms by blast
qed

end

Theory Miscellaneous_Groups

(*
    File:     Miscellaneous_Groups.thy
    Author:   Joseph Thommes, TU MÃ¼nchen

section â€¹Miscellaneous group factsâ€º

theory Miscellaneous_Groups
  imports Set_Multiplication
begin

text â€¹As the name suggests, this section contains several smaller lemmas about groups.â€º

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in subgroup) nat_pow_closed [simp,intro]: "a âˆˆ H âŸ¹ pow G a (n::nat) âˆˆ H"
  by (induction n) (auto simp: nat_pow_def)

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma nat_pow_modify_carrier: "a [^]â‡˜Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆâ‡™ b = a [^]â‡˜Gâ‡™ (b::nat)"
  by (simp add: nat_pow_def)

lemma (in group) subgroup_card_dvd_group_ord:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "card H dvd order G"
  using Coset.group.lagrange[of G H] assms group_axioms by (metis dvd_triv_right)

lemma (in group) subgroup_card_eq_order:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "card H = order (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)"
  unfolding order_def by simp

lemma (in group) finite_subgroup_card_neq_0:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "finite H"
  shows "card H â‰  0"
  using subgroup_nonempty assms by auto

lemma (in group) subgroup_order_dvd_group_order:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "order (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) dvd order G"
  by (metis subgroup_card_dvd_group_ord[of H] assms subgroup_card_eq_order)

lemma (in group) sub_subgroup_dvd_card:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "J âŠ† H"
  shows "card J dvd card H"
  by (metis subgroup_incl[of J H] subgroup_card_eq_order[of H]
            group.subgroup_card_dvd_group_ord[of "(Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" J] assms
            subgroup.subgroup_is_group[of H G] group_axioms)

lemma (in group) inter_subgroup_dvd_card:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G"
  shows "card (H âˆ© J) dvd card H"
  using subgroups_Inter_pair[of H J] assms sub_subgroup_dvd_card[of H "H âˆ© J"] by blast

lemma (in group) subgroups_card_coprime_inter_card_one:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "coprime (card H) (card J)"
  shows "card (H âˆ© J) = 1"
proof -
  from assms inter_subgroup_dvd_card have "is_unit (card (H âˆ© J))" unfolding coprime_def
    by (meson Int_lower2 sub_subgroup_dvd_card subgroup_Int)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma (in group) coset_neq_imp_empty_inter:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "a âˆˆ carrier G" "b âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "H #> a â‰  H #> b âŸ¹ (H #> a) âˆ© (H #> b) = {}"
  by (metis Int_emptyI assms repr_independence)

lemma (in comm_group) subgroup_is_comm_group:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "comm_group (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" unfolding comm_group_def
proof
  interpret H: subgroup H G by fact
  interpret H: submonoid H G using H.subgroup_is_submonoid .
  show "Group.group (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" by blast
  show "comm_monoid (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" using submonoid_is_comm_monoid H.submonoid_axioms by blast
qed

lemma (in group) pow_int_mod_ord:
  assumes [simp]:"a âˆˆ carrier G" "ord a â‰  0"
  shows "a [^] (n::int) = a [^] (n mod ord a)"
proof -
  obtain q r where d: "q = n div ord a" "r = n mod ord a" "n = q * ord a + r"
    using mod_div_decomp by blast
  hence "a [^] n = (a [^] int (ord a)) [^] q âŠ— a [^] r"
    using assms(1) int_pow_mult int_pow_pow
    by (metis mult_of_nat_commute)
  also have "â€¦ = ğŸ­ [^] q âŠ— a [^] r"
    by (simp add: int_pow_int)
  also have "â€¦ = a [^] r" by simp
  finally show ?thesis using d(2) by blast
qed

lemma (in group) pow_nat_mod_ord:
  assumes [simp]:"a âˆˆ carrier G" "ord a â‰  0"
  shows "a [^] (n::nat) = a [^] (n mod ord a)"
proof -
  obtain q r where d: "q = n div ord a" "r = n mod ord a" "n = q * ord a + r"
    using mod_div_decomp by blast
  hence "a [^] n = (a [^] ord a) [^] q âŠ— a [^] r"
    using assms(1) nat_pow_mult nat_pow_pow by presburger
  also have "â€¦ = ğŸ­ [^] q âŠ— a [^] r" by auto
  also have "â€¦ = a [^] r" by simp
  finally show ?thesis using d(2) by blast
qed

lemma (in group) ord_min:
  assumes "m â‰¥ 1" "x âˆˆ carrier G" "x [^] m = ğŸ­"
  shows   "ord x â‰¤ m"
  using assms pow_eq_id by auto

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in group) bij_betw_mult_left[intro]:
  assumes [simp]: "x âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "bij_betw (Î»y. x âŠ— y) (carrier G) (carrier G)"
  by (intro bij_betwI[where ?g = "Î»y. inv x âŠ— y"])
     (auto simp: m_assoc [symmetric])

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in subgroup) inv_in_iff:
  assumes "x âˆˆ carrier G" "group G"
  shows   "inv x âˆˆ H âŸ· x âˆˆ H"
proof safe
  assume "inv x âˆˆ H"
  hence "inv (inv x) âˆˆ H" by blast
  also have "inv (inv x) = x"
    by (intro group.inv_inv) (use assms in auto)
  finally show "x âˆˆ H" .
qed auto

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in subgroup) mult_in_cancel_left:
  assumes "y âˆˆ carrier G" "x âˆˆ H" "group G"
  shows   "x âŠ— y âˆˆ H âŸ· y âˆˆ H"
proof safe
  assume "x âŠ— y âˆˆ H"
  hence "inv x âŠ— (x âŠ— y) âˆˆ H"
    using assms by blast
  also have "inv x âŠ— (x âŠ— y) = y"
    using assms by (simp add: â€¹x âŠ— y âˆˆ Hâ€º group.inv_solve_left')
  finally show "y âˆˆ H" .
qed (use assms in auto)

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in subgroup) mult_in_cancel_right:
  assumes "x âˆˆ carrier G" "y âˆˆ H" "group G"
  shows   "x âŠ— y âˆˆ H âŸ· x âˆˆ H"
proof safe
  assume "x âŠ— y âˆˆ H"
  hence "(x âŠ— y) âŠ— inv y âˆˆ H"
    using assms by blast
  also have "(x âŠ— y) âŠ— inv y = x"
    using assms by (simp add: â€¹x âŠ— y âˆˆ Hâ€º group.inv_solve_right')
  finally show "x âˆˆ H" .
qed (use assms in auto)

lemma (in group) (* Manuel Eberl *)
  assumes "x âˆˆ carrier G" and "x [^] n = ğŸ­" and "n > 0"
  shows   ord_le: "ord x â‰¤ n" and ord_pos: "ord x > 0"
proof -
  have "ord x dvd n"
    using pow_eq_id[of x n] assms by auto
  thus "ord x â‰¤ n" "ord x > 0"
    using assms by (auto intro: dvd_imp_le)
qed

lemma (in group) ord_conv_Least: (* Manuel Eberl *)
  assumes "x âˆˆ carrier G" "âˆƒn::nat > 0. x [^] n = ğŸ­"
  shows   "ord x = (LEAST n::nat. 0 < n âˆ§ x [^] n = ğŸ­)"
proof (rule antisym)
  show "ord x â‰¤ (LEAST n::nat. 0 < n âˆ§ x [^] n = ğŸ­)"
    using assms LeastI_ex[OF assms(2)] by (intro ord_le) auto
  show "ord x â‰¥ (LEAST n::nat. 0 < n âˆ§ x [^] n = ğŸ­)"
    using assms by (intro Least_le) (auto intro: pow_ord_eq_1 ord_pos)
qed

lemma (in group) ord_conv_Gcd: (* Manuel Eberl *)
  assumes "x âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows   "ord x = Gcd {n. x [^] n = ğŸ­}"
  by (rule sym, rule Gcd_eqI) (use assms in â€¹auto simp: pow_eq_idâ€º)

lemma (in group) subgroup_ord_eq:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "x âˆˆ H"
  shows "group.ord (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) x = ord x"
  using nat_pow_consistent ord_def group.ord_def[of "(Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" x]
        subgroup.subgroup_is_group[of H G] assms by simp

lemma (in group) ord_FactGroup:
  assumes "subgroup P G" "group (G Mod P)"
  shows "order (G Mod P) * card P = order G"
  using lagrange[of P] FactGroup_def[of G P] assms order_def[of "(G Mod P)"] by fastforce

lemma (in group) one_is_same:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "ğŸ­â‡˜Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆâ‡™ = ğŸ­"
  by simp

lemma (in group) kernel_FactGroup:
  assumes "P âŠ² G"
  shows "kernel G (G Mod P) (Î»x. P #> x) = P"
proof(rule equalityI; rule subsetI)
  fix x
  assume "x âˆˆ kernel G (G Mod P) ((#>) P)"
  then have "P #> x = ğŸ­â‡˜G Mod Pâ‡™" "x âˆˆ carrier G" unfolding kernel_def by simp+
  with coset_join1[of P x] show "x âˆˆ P" using assms unfolding normal_def by simp
next
  fix x
  assume x:"x âˆˆ P"
  then have xc: "x âˆˆ carrier G" using assms subgroup.subset unfolding normal_def by fast
  from x have "P #> x = P" using assms
    by (simp add: normal_imp_subgroup subgroup.rcos_const) 
  thus "x âˆˆ kernel G (G Mod P) ((#>) P)" unfolding kernel_def using xc by simp
qed

lemma (in group) sub_subgroup_coprime:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "coprime (card H) (card J)"
  and "subgroup sH G" "subgroup sJ G" "sH âŠ† H" "sJ âŠ† J"
shows "coprime (card sH) (card sJ)"
  using assms by (meson coprime_divisors sub_subgroup_dvd_card)

lemma (in group) pow_eq_nat_mod:
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" "a [^] n = a [^] m"
  shows "n mod (ord a) = m mod (ord a)"
proof -
  from assms have "a [^] (n - m) = ğŸ­" using pow_eq_div2 by blast
  hence "ord a dvd n - m" using assms(1) pow_eq_id by blast
  thus ?thesis
    by (metis assms mod_eq_dvd_iff_nat nat_le_linear pow_eq_div2 pow_eq_id)
qed

lemma (in group) pow_eq_int_mod:
  fixes n m::int
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" "a [^] n = a [^] m"
  shows "n mod (ord a) = m mod (ord a)"
proof -
  from assms have "a [^] (n - m) = ğŸ­" using int_pow_closed int_pow_diff r_inv by presburger
  hence "ord a dvd n - m" using assms(1) int_pow_eq_id by blast
  thus ?thesis by (meson mod_eq_dvd_iff)
qed

end

Theory Generated_Groups_Extend

(*

section â€¹Generated Groupsâ€º

theory Generated_Groups_Extend
  imports Miscellaneous_Groups "HOL-Algebra.Algebra"
begin

text â€¹This section extends the lemmas and facts about â€¹generateâ€º. Starting with a basic fact.â€º

lemma (in group) generate_sincl:
  "A âŠ† generate G A"
  using generate.incl by fast

text â€¹The following lemmas reflect some of the idempotence characteristics of â€¹generateâ€º and have
proved useful at several occasions.â€º

lemma (in group) generate_idem:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G (generate G A) = generate G A"
  using assms generateI group.generate_is_subgroup by blast

lemma (in group) generate_idem':
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "B âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G (generate G A âˆª B) = generate G (A âˆª B)"
proof
  show "generate G (generate G A âˆª B) âŠ† generate G (A âˆª B)"
  proof -
    have "generate G A âˆª B âŠ† generate G (A âˆª B)"
    proof -
      have "generate G A âŠ† generate G (A âˆª B)" using mono_generate by simp
      moreover have "B âŠ† generate G (A âˆª B)" by (simp add: generate.incl subset_iff)
      ultimately show ?thesis by simp
    qed
    then have "generate G (generate G A âˆª B) âŠ† generate G (generate G (A âˆª B))"
      using mono_generate by auto
    with generate_idem[of "A âˆª B"] show ?thesis using assms by simp
  qed
  show "generate G (A âˆª B) âŠ† generate G (generate G A âˆª B)"
  proof -
    have "A âŠ† generate G A" using generate.incl by fast
    thus ?thesis using mono_generate[of "A âˆª B" "generate G A âˆª B"] by blast
  qed
qed

lemma (in group) generate_idem'_right:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "B âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G (A âˆª generate G B) = generate G (A âˆª B)"
  using generate_idem'[OF assms(2) assms(1)] by (simp add: sup_commute)

lemma (in group) generate_idem_Un:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G (â‹ƒxâˆˆA. generate G {x}) = generate G A"
proof
  have "A âŠ† (â‹ƒxâˆˆA. generate G {x})" using generate.incl by force
  thus "generate G A âŠ† generate G (â‹ƒxâˆˆA. generate G {x})" using mono_generate by presburger
  have "â‹€x. x âˆˆ A âŸ¹ generate G {x} âŠ† generate G A" using mono_generate by auto
  hence "(â‹ƒxâˆˆA. generate G {x}) âŠ† generate G A" by blast
  thus "generate G (â‹ƒxâˆˆA. generate G {x}) âŠ† generate G A"
    using generate_idem[OF assms] mono_generate by blast
qed

lemma (in group) generate_idem_fUn:
  assumes "f A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f A}) = generate G (f A)"
proof
  have "f A âŠ† â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f A}"
  proof
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ f A"
    have "x âˆˆ generate G {x}" using generate.incl by fast
    thus "x âˆˆ â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f A}" using x by blast
  qed
  thus "generate G (f A) âŠ† generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f A})" using mono_generate by auto
  have "â‹€x. x âˆˆ f A âŸ¹ generate G {x} âŠ† generate G (f A)" using mono_generate by simp
  hence "(â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f A}) âŠ† generate G (f A)" by blast
  with mono_generate[OF this] show "generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f A}) âŠ† generate G (f A)"
    using generate_idem[OF assms] by simp
qed

lemma (in group) generate_idem_fim_Un:
  assumes "â‹ƒ(f ` A) âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G (â‹ƒS âˆˆ A. generate G (f S)) = generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)})"
proof
  
  have "â‹€S. S âˆˆ A âŸ¹ generate G (f S) = generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f S})"
    using generate_idem_fUn[of f] assms by blast
  then have "generate G (â‹ƒS âˆˆ A. generate G (f S))
           = generate G (â‹ƒS âˆˆ A. generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ f S}))" by simp

  have "â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)} âŠ† (â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S))"
  proof
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)}"
    then obtain a where a: "x âˆˆ generate G {a}" "a âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)" by blast
    then obtain M where M: "a âˆˆ f M" "M âˆˆ A" by blast
    then have "generate G {a} âŠ† generate G (f M)"
      using generate.incl[OF M(1), of G] mono_generate[of "{a}" "generate G (f M)"]
            generate_idem assms by auto
    then have "x âˆˆ generate G (f M)" using a by blast
    thus "x âˆˆ (â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S))" using M by blast
  qed
  thus "generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)}) âŠ† generate G (â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S))"
    using mono_generate by simp
  have a: "generate G (â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S)) âŠ† generate G (â‹ƒ (f ` A))"
  proof -
    have "â‹€S. S âˆˆ A âŸ¹ generate G (f S) âŠ† generate G (â‹ƒ (f ` A))"
      using mono_generate[of _ "â‹ƒ (f ` A)"] by blast
    then have "(â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S)) âŠ† generate G (â‹ƒ (f ` A))" by blast
    then have "generate G (â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S)) âŠ† generate G (generate G (â‹ƒ (f ` A)))"
      using mono_generate by meson
    thus "generate G (â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S)) âŠ†  generate G (â‹ƒ (f ` A))"
      using generate_idem assms by blast
  qed
  have "â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)} = (â‹ƒxâˆˆâ‹ƒ (f ` A). generate G {x})" by blast
  with generate_idem_Un[OF assms]
  have "generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)}) = generate G (â‹ƒ (f ` A))" by simp
  with a show "generate G (â‹ƒSâˆˆA. generate G (f S))
             âŠ† generate G (â‹ƒ {generate G {x} |x. x âˆˆ â‹ƒ (f ` A)})" by blast
qed

text â€¹The following two rules allow for convenient proving of the equality of two generated sets.â€º

lemma (in group) generate_eqI:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "B âŠ† carrier G" "A âŠ† generate G B" "B âŠ† generate G A"
  shows "generate G A = generate G B"
  using assms generate_idem by (metis generate_idem' inf_sup_aci(5) sup.absorb2)

lemma (in group) generate_one_switched_eqI:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "a âˆˆ A" "B = (A - {a}) âˆª {b}"
  and "b âˆˆ generate G A" "a âˆˆ generate G B"
  shows "generate G A = generate G B"
proof(intro generate_eqI)
  show "A âŠ† carrier G" by fact
  show "B âŠ† carrier G" using assms generate_incl by blast
  show "A âŠ† generate G B" using assms generate_sincl[of B] by blast
  show "B âŠ† generate G A" using assms generate_sincl[of A] by blast
qed

lemma (in group) generate_subset_eqI:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "B âŠ† A" "A - B âŠ† generate G B"
  shows "generate G A = generate G B"
proof
  show "generate G B âŠ† generate G A" by (intro mono_generate, fact)
  show "generate G A âŠ† generate G B"
  proof(subst generate_idem[of "B", symmetric])
    show "generate G A âŠ† generate G (generate G B)"
      by (intro mono_generate, use assms generate_sincl[of B] in auto)
  qed (use assms in blast)
qed

text â€¹Some smaller lemmas about â€¹generateâ€º.â€º

lemma (in group) generate_subset_change_eqI:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "B âŠ† carrier G" "C âŠ† carrier G" "generate G A = generate G B"
  shows "generate G (A âˆª C) = generate G (B âˆª C)"
  by (metis assms generate_idem')

lemma (in group) generate_subgroup_id:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "generate G H = H"
  using assms generateI by auto

lemma (in group) generate_consistent':
  assumes "subgroup H G" "A âŠ† H"
  shows "âˆ€x âˆˆ A. generate G {x} = generate (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) {x}"
  using generate_consistent assms by auto

lemma (in group) generate_singleton_one:
  assumes "generate G {a} = {ğŸ­}"
  shows "a = ğŸ­"
  using generate.incl[of a "{a}" G] assms by auto

lemma (in group) generate_inv_eq:
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "generate G {a} = generate G {inv a}"
  by (intro generate_eqI;
      use assms generate.inv[of a] generate.inv[of "inv a" "{inv a}" G] inv_inv[OF assms] in auto)

lemma (in group) generate_eq_imp_subset:
  assumes "generate G A = generate G B"
  shows "A âŠ† generate G B"
  using generate.incl assms by fast


text â€¹The neutral element does not play a role when generating a subgroup.â€º

lemma (in group) generate_one_irrel:
  "generate G A = generate G (A âˆª {ğŸ­})"
proof
  show "generate G A âŠ† generate G (A âˆª {ğŸ­})" by (intro mono_generate, blast)
  show "generate G (A âˆª {ğŸ­}) âŠ† generate G A"
  proof(rule subsetI)
    show "x âˆˆ generate G A" if "x âˆˆ generate G (A âˆª {ğŸ­})" for x using that
      by (induction rule: generate.induct;
          use generate.one generate.incl generate.inv generate.eng in auto)
  qed
qed

lemma (in group) generate_one_irrel':
  "generate G A = generate G (A - {ğŸ­})"
  using generate_one_irrel by (metis Un_Diff_cancel2)

text â€¹Also, we can express the subgroup generated by a singleton with finite order using just its
powers up to its order.â€º

lemma (in group) generate_nat_pow:
  assumes "ord a â‰  0" "a âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "generate G {a} = {a [^] k |k. k âˆˆ {0..ord a - 1}}"
  using assms generate_pow_nat ord_elems_inf_carrier by auto

lemma (in group) generate_nat_pow':
  assumes "ord a â‰  0" "a âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "generate G {a} = {a [^] k |k. k âˆˆ {1..ord a}}"
proof -
  have "{a [^] k |k. k âˆˆ {1..ord a}} = {a [^] k |k. k âˆˆ {0..ord a - 1}}"
  proof -
    have "a [^] k âˆˆ {a [^] k |k. k âˆˆ {0..ord a - 1}}" if "k âˆˆ {1..ord a}" for k
      using that pow_nat_mod_ord[OF assms(2, 1), of "ord a"] assms by (cases "k = ord a"; force)
    moreover have "a [^] k âˆˆ {a [^] k |k. k âˆˆ {1..ord a}}" if "k âˆˆ {0..ord a - 1}" for k
    proof(cases "k = 0")
      case True
      hence "a [^] k = a [^] ord a" using pow_ord_eq_1[OF assms(2)] by auto
      moreover have "ord a âˆˆ {1..ord a}"
        using assms unfolding atLeastAtMost_def atLeast_def atMost_def by auto
      ultimately show ?thesis by blast
    next
      case False
      then show ?thesis using that by auto
    qed 
    ultimately show ?thesis by blast
  qed
  with generate_nat_pow[OF assms] show ?thesis by simp
qed

end

Theory General_Auxiliary

section â€¹Auxiliary lemmasâ€º

theory General_Auxiliary
  imports "HOL-Algebra.Algebra"
begin

lemma inter_imp_subset: "A âˆ© B = A âŸ¹ A âŠ† B"
  by blast

lemma card_inter_eq:
  assumes "finite A" "card (A âˆ© B) = card A"
  shows "A âŠ† B"
proof -
  have "A âˆ© B âŠ† A" by blast
  with assms have "A âˆ© B = A" using card_subset_eq by blast
  thus ?thesis by blast
qed

lemma coprime_eq_empty_prime_inter:
  assumes "(n::nat) â‰  0" "m â‰  0"
  shows "coprime n m âŸ· (prime_factors n) âˆ© (prime_factors m) = {}"
proof
  show "coprime n m âŸ¹ prime_factors n âˆ© prime_factors m = {}"
  proof (rule ccontr)
    assume cp: "coprime n m"
    assume pf: "prime_factors n âˆ© prime_factors m â‰  {}"
    then obtain p where p: "p âˆˆ prime_factors n" "p âˆˆ prime_factors m" by blast
    then have p_dvd: "p dvd n" "p dvd m" by blast+
    moreover have "Â¬is_unit p" using p using not_prime_unit by blast
    ultimately show "False" using cp unfolding coprime_def by simp
  qed
  assume assm: "prime_factors n âˆ© prime_factors m = {}"
  show "coprime n m" unfolding coprime_def
  proof
    fix c
    show "c dvd n âŸ¶ c dvd m âŸ¶ is_unit c"
    proof(rule; rule)
      assume c: "c dvd n" "c dvd m"
      then have "prime_factors c âŠ† prime_factors n" "prime_factors c âŠ† prime_factors m"
        using assms dvd_prime_factors by blast+
      then have "prime_factors c = {}" using assm by blast
      thus "is_unit c" using assms c
        by (metis dvd_0_left_iff prime_factorization_empty_iff set_mset_eq_empty_iff)
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma prime_factors_Prod:
  assumes "finite S" "â‹€a. a âˆˆ S âŸ¹ f a â‰  0"
  shows "prime_factors (prod f S) = â‹ƒ(prime_factors ` f ` S)"
  using assms
proof(induction S rule: finite_induct)
  case empty
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case i: (insert x F)
  from i have x: "f x â‰  0" by blast
  from i have F: "prod f F â‰  0" by simp
  from i have "prime_factors(prod f F) = â‹ƒ (prime_factors ` f ` F)" by blast
  moreover have "prod f (insert x F) = (prod f F) * f x" using i mult.commute by force
  ultimately
  have "prime_factors (prod f (insert x F)) = (â‹ƒ(prime_factors ` f ` F)) âˆª prime_factors (f x)"
    using prime_factors_product[OF F x] by argo
  thus ?case by force
qed

lemma lcm_is_Min_multiple_nat:
  assumes "c â‰  0" "(a::nat) dvd c" "(b::nat) dvd c"
  shows "c â‰¥ lcm a b"
  using lcm_least[of a c b] assms by fastforce

lemma diff_prime_power_imp_coprime:
  assumes "p â‰  q" "Factorial_Ring.prime (p::nat)" "Factorial_Ring.prime q"
  shows "coprime (p ^ (n::nat)) (q ^ m)"
  using assms
  by (metis power_0 power_one_right prime_dvd_power prime_imp_power_coprime_nat
            prime_nat_iff prime_power_inj'')

lemma "finite (prime_factors x)"
  using finite_set_mset by blast

lemma card_ge_1_two_diff:
  assumes "card A > 1"
  obtains x y where "x âˆˆ A" "y âˆˆ A" "x â‰  y"
proof -
  have fA: "finite A" using assms by (metis card.infinite not_one_less_zero)
  from assms obtain x where x: "x âˆˆ A" by fastforce
  with assms fA have "card (A - {x}) > 0" by simp
  then obtain y where y: "y âˆˆ (A - {x})" by (metis card_gt_0_iff ex_in_conv)
  thus ?thesis using that[of x y] x by blast
qed

lemma infinite_two_diff:
  assumes "infinite A"
  obtains x y where "x âˆˆ A" "y âˆˆ A" "x â‰  y"
proof -
  from assms obtain x where x: "x âˆˆ A" by fastforce
  from assms have "infinite (A - {x})" by simp
  then obtain y where y: "y âˆˆ (A - {x})"
    by (metis ex_in_conv finite.emptyI)
  show ?thesis using that[of x y] using x y by blast
qed

lemma Inf_le:
  "Inf A â‰¤ x" if "x âˆˆ (A::nat set)" for x
proof (cases "A = {}")
  case True
  then show ?thesis using that by simp
next
  case False
  hence "Inf A â‰¤ Inf {x}" using that by (simp add: cInf_lower)
  also have "â€¦ = x" by simp
  finally show "Inf A â‰¤ x" by blast
qed

lemma switch_elem_card_le:
  assumes "a âˆˆ A"
  shows "card (A - {a} âˆª {b}) â‰¤ card A"
  using assms
  by (metis Diff_insert_absorb Set.set_insert Un_commute card.infinite card_insert_disjoint
            card_mono finite_insert insert_is_Un insert_subset order_refl)

lemma pairwise_coprime_dvd:
  assumes "finite A" "pairwise coprime A" "(n::nat) = prod id A" "âˆ€aâˆˆA. a dvd j"
  shows "n dvd j"
  using assms
proof (induction A arbitrary: n)
  case i: (insert x F)
  have "prod id F dvd j" "x dvd j" using i unfolding pairwise_def by auto
  moreover have "coprime (prod id F) x"
    by (metis i(2, 4) id_apply pairwise_insert prod_coprime_left)
  ultimately show ?case using i(1, 2, 5) by (simp add: coprime_commute divides_mult)
qed simp

lemma pairwise_coprime_dvd':
  assumes "finite A" "â‹€i j. âŸ¦i âˆˆ A; j âˆˆ A; i â‰  jâŸ§ âŸ¹ coprime (f i) (f j)"
          "(n::nat) = prod f A" "âˆ€aâˆˆA. f a dvd j"
  shows "n dvd j"
  using assms
proof (induction A arbitrary: n)
  case i: (insert x F)
  have "prod f F dvd j" "f x dvd j" using i unfolding pairwise_def by auto
  moreover have "coprime (prod f F) (f x)" by(intro prod_coprime_left, use i in blast)
  ultimately show ?case using i by (simp add: coprime_commute divides_mult)
qed simp

lemma transp_successively_remove1:
  assumes "transp f" "successively f l"
  shows "successively f (remove1 a l)" using assms(2)
proof(induction l rule: induct_list012)
  case (3 x y zs)
  from 3(3)[unfolded successively.simps] have fs: "f x y" "successively f (y # zs)" by auto
  moreover from this(2) successively.simps have s: "successively f zs" by(cases zs, auto)
  ultimately have s2: "successively f (remove1 a zs)" "successively f (remove1 a (y # zs))"
    using 3 by auto
  consider (x) "x = a" | (y) "y = a âˆ§ x â‰  a" | (zs) "a â‰  x âˆ§ a â‰  y" by blast
  thus ?case
  proof (cases)
    case x
    then show ?thesis using 3 by simp
  next
    case y
    then show ?thesis
    proof (cases zs)
      case Nil
      then show ?thesis using fs by simp
    next
      case (Cons a list)
      hence "f y a" using fs by simp
      hence "f x a" using fs(1) assms(1)[unfolded transp_def] by blast
      then show ?thesis using Cons y s by auto
    qed
  next
    case zs
    then show ?thesis using s2 fs by auto
  qed
qed auto


lemma exp_one_2pi_iff:
  fixes x::real shows "exp (2 * of_real pi * ğ—‚ * x) = 1 âŸ· x âˆˆ â„¤"
proof -
  have c: "cis (2 * x * pi) = 1 âŸ· x âˆˆ â„¤"
    by (auto simp: complex_eq_iff sin_times_pi_eq_0 cos_one_2pi_int, meson Ints_cases)
  have "exp (2 * of_real pi * ğ—‚ * x) = exp (ğ—‚ * complex_of_real (2 * x * pi))"
  proof -
    have "2 * of_real pi * ğ—‚ * x = ğ—‚ * complex_of_real (2 * x * pi)" by simp
    thus ?thesis by argo
  qed
  also from cis_conv_exp have "â€¦ = cis (2 * x * pi)" by simp
  finally show ?thesis using c by simp
qed

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma of_int_divide_in_Ints_iff:
  assumes "b â‰  0"
  shows   "(of_int a / of_int b :: 'a :: field_char_0) âˆˆ â„¤ âŸ· b dvd a"
proof
  assume *: "(of_int a / of_int b :: 'a :: field_char_0) âˆˆ â„¤"
  from * obtain n where "of_int a / of_int b = (of_int n :: 'a)"
    by (elim Ints_cases)
  hence "of_int (b * n) = (of_int a :: 'a)"
    using assms by (subst of_int_mult) (auto simp: field_simps)
  hence "b * n = a"
    by (subst (asm) of_int_eq_iff)
  thus "b dvd a" by auto
qed auto

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma of_nat_divide_in_Ints_iff:
  assumes "b â‰  0"
  shows   "(of_nat a / of_nat b :: 'a :: field_char_0) âˆˆ â„¤ âŸ· b dvd a"
  using of_int_divide_in_Ints_iff[of "int b" "int a"] assms by simp

lemma true_nth_unity_root:
  fixes n::nat
  obtains x::complex where "x ^ n = 1" "â‹€m. âŸ¦0<m; m<nâŸ§ âŸ¹ x ^ m â‰  1"
proof(cases "n = 0")
  case False
  show ?thesis
  proof (rule that)
    show "cis (2 * pi / n) ^ n = 1"
      by (simp add: DeMoivre)
  next
    fix m assume m: "m > 0" "m < n"
    have "cis (2 * pi / n) ^ m = cis (2 * pi * m / n)"
      by (simp add: DeMoivre algebra_simps)
    also have "â€¦ = 1 âŸ· real m / real n âˆˆ â„¤"
      using exp_one_2pi_iff[of "m / n"] by (simp add: cis_conv_exp algebra_simps)
    also have "â€¦ âŸ· n dvd m"
      using m by (subst of_nat_divide_in_Ints_iff) auto
    also have "Â¬n dvd m"
      using m by auto
    finally show "cis (2 * pi / real n) ^ m â‰  1" .
  qed
qed simp

lemma finite_bij_betwI:
  assumes "finite A" "finite B" "inj_on f A" "f âˆˆ A â†’ B" "card A = card B"
  shows "bij_betw f A B"
proof (intro bij_betw_imageI)
  show "inj_on f A" by fact
  show "f ` A = B"
  proof -
    have "card (f ` A) = card B" using assms by (simp add: card_image)
    moreover have "f ` A âŠ† B" using assms by blast
    ultimately show ?thesis using assms by (meson card_subset_eq)
  qed
qed

lemma powi_mod:
  "x powi m = x powi (m mod n)" if "x ^ n = 1" "n > 0" for x::complex and m::int
proof -
  have xnz: "x â‰  0" using that by (metis zero_neq_one zero_power)
  obtain k::int where k: "m = k*n + (m mod n)" using div_mod_decomp_int by blast
  have "x powi m = x powi (k*n) * x powi (m mod n)" by (subst k, intro power_int_add, use xnz in auto)
  moreover have "x powi (k*n) = 1" using that
    by (metis mult.commute power_int_1_left power_int_mult power_int_of_nat)
  ultimately show ?thesis by force
qed

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma Sigma_insert: "Sigma (insert x A) B = (Î»y. (x, y)) ` B x âˆª Sigma A B"
  by auto

end

Theory IDirProds

(*

section â€¹Internal direct productâ€º

theory IDirProds
  imports Generated_Groups_Extend General_Auxiliary
begin

subsection â€¹Complementarityâ€º

text â€¹We introduce the notion of complementarity, that plays a central role in the internal
direct group product and prove some basic properties about it.â€º

definition (in group) complementary :: "'a set â‡’ 'a set â‡’ bool" where
  "complementary H1 H2 âŸ· H1 âˆ© H2 = {ğŸ­}"

lemma (in group) complementary_symm: "complementary A B âŸ· complementary B A"
  unfolding complementary_def by blast

lemma (in group) subgroup_carrier_complementary:
  assumes "complementary H J" "subgroup I (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" "subgroup K (Gâ¦‡carrier := Jâ¦ˆ)"
  shows "complementary I K"
proof -
  have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ I"  "ğŸ­ âˆˆ K" using subgroup.one_closed assms by fastforce+
  moreover have "I âˆ© K âŠ† H âˆ© J" using subgroup.subset assms by force
  ultimately show ?thesis using assms unfolding complementary_def by blast
qed

lemma (in group) subgroup_subset_complementary:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "subgroup I G"
  and "I âŠ† J" "complementary H J"
shows "complementary H I"
  by (intro subgroup_carrier_complementary[OF assms(5), of H I] subgroup_incl, use assms in auto)

lemma (in group) complementary_subgroup_iff:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "complementary A B âŸ· group.complementary (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) A B"
proof -
  interpret H: group "Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ" using subgroup.subgroup_is_group assms by blast
  have "ğŸ­â‡˜Gâ‡™ = ğŸ­â‡˜Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆâ‡™" by simp
  then show ?thesis unfolding complementary_def H.complementary_def by simp
qed

lemma (in group) subgroups_card_coprime_imp_compl:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "coprime (card H) (card J)"
  shows "complementary H J" unfolding complementary_def
proof -
  interpret JH: subgroup "(H âˆ© J)" G using assms subgroups_Inter_pair by blast
  from subgroups_card_coprime_inter_card_one[OF assms] show "H âˆ© J = {ğŸ­}" using JH.one_closed
    by (metis card_1_singletonE singletonD)
qed

lemma (in group) prime_power_complementary_groups:
  assumes "Factorial_Ring.prime p" "Factorial_Ring.prime q" "p â‰  q"
  and "subgroup P G" "card P = p ^ x"
  and "subgroup Q G" "card Q = q ^ y"
  shows "complementary P Q"
proof -
  from assms have "coprime (card P) (card Q)"
    by (metis coprime_power_right_iff primes_coprime coprime_def)
  then show ?thesis using subgroups_card_coprime_imp_compl assms complementary_def by blast
qed

text â€¹With the previous work from the theory about set multiplication we can characterize
complementarity of two subgroups in abelian groups by the cardinality of their product.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) compl_imp_diff_cosets:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "finite H" "finite J"
  and "complementary H J"
  shows "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ J; b âˆˆ J; a â‰  bâŸ§ âŸ¹ (H #> a) â‰  (H #> b)"
proof (rule ccontr; safe)
  fix a b
  assume ab: "a âˆˆ J" "b âˆˆ J" "a â‰  b"
  then have [simp]: "a âˆˆ carrier G" "b âˆˆ carrier G" using assms subgroup.subset by auto
  assume "H #> a = H #> b"
  then have "a âŠ— inv b âˆˆ H" using assms(1, 2) ab
    by (metis comm_group_axioms comm_group_def rcos_self
              subgroup.mem_carrier subgroup.rcos_module_imp)
  moreover have "a âŠ— inv b âˆˆ J"
    by (rule subgroup.m_closed[OF assms(2) ab(1) subgroup.m_inv_closed[OF assms(2) ab(2)]])
  moreover have "a âŠ— inv b â‰  ğŸ­" using ab inv_equality by fastforce
  ultimately have "H âˆ© J â‰  {ğŸ­}" by blast
  thus False using assms(5) unfolding complementary_def by blast
qed

lemma (in comm_group) finite_sub_card_eq_mult_imp_comp:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "finite H" "finite J"
  and "card (H <#> J) = (card J * card H)"
  shows "complementary H J"
  unfolding complementary_def
proof (rule ccontr)
  assume "H âˆ© J â‰  {ğŸ­}"
  have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ H" using subgroup.one_closed assms(1) by blast
  moreover have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ J" using subgroup.one_closed assms(2) by blast
  ultimately have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ (H âˆ© J)" by blast

  then obtain a where a_def: "a âˆˆ (H âˆ© J) âˆ§ a â‰  ğŸ­" using â€¹H âˆ© J â‰  {ğŸ­}â€º by blast
  then have aH: "a âˆˆ H" by blast
  then have a_inv_H: "inv a âˆˆ H âˆ§ inv a â‰  ğŸ­" using assms(1)
    by (meson a_def inv_eq_1_iff subgroup.mem_carrier subgroupE(3))
  from a_def have aJ: "a âˆˆ J" by blast
  then have a_inv_J: "inv a âˆˆ J âˆ§ inv a â‰  ğŸ­" using assms(2)
    by (meson a_def inv_eq_1_iff subgroup.mem_carrier subgroupE(3))
  from a_def have a_c: "a âˆˆ carrier G" using subgroup.subset[of J G] assms(2) by blast

  from set_mult_card_eq_impl_empty_inter'[of H J]
  have empty: "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ H; b âˆˆ H; a â‰  bâŸ§ âŸ¹ (l_coset G a J) âˆ© (l_coset G b J) = {}"
    using assms subgroup.subset[of _ G] by simp

  have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ ğŸ­ <# J" using â€¹ğŸ­ âˆˆ Jâ€º unfolding l_coset_def by force
  moreover have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ a <# J" using a_inv_J aJ a_c assms â€¹ğŸ­ âˆˆ Jâ€º coset_join3 by blast
  ultimately have "(l_coset G ğŸ­ J) âˆ© (l_coset G a J) â‰  {}" by blast

  then show "False" using empty[of "ğŸ­" a] a_def aH â€¹ğŸ­ âˆˆ Hâ€º by blast
qed

lemma (in comm_group) finite_sub_comp_imp_card_eq_mult:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "finite H" "finite J"
  and "complementary H J"
shows "card (H <#> J) = card J * card H"
proof -
  have carr: "H âŠ† carrier G" "J âŠ† carrier G" using assms subgroup.subset by auto

  from coset_neq_imp_empty_inter[OF assms(1)] compl_imp_diff_cosets[OF assms(1,2)]
  have em_inter: "â‹€a b. âŸ¦a âˆˆ J; b âˆˆ J; a â‰  bâŸ§ âŸ¹ (H #> a) âˆ© (H #> b) = {}"
    by (meson assms subgroup.mem_carrier)

  have "card (â‹ƒaâˆˆJ. (H #> a)) = card J * card H" using assms(4) carr(2) em_inter
  proof (induction J rule: finite_induct)
    case empty
    then show ?case by auto
  next
    case i: (insert x F)
    then have cF:"card (â‹ƒ ((#>) H ` F)) = card F * card H" by blast
    have xc[simp]: "x âˆˆ carrier G" using i(4) by simp
    let ?J = "insert x F"
    from i(2, 4, 5) have em:"(H #> x) âˆ© (â‹ƒyâˆˆF. (H #> y)) = {}" by auto
    have "finite (H #> x)"
      by (meson carr(1) rcosetsI rcosets_finite assms(3) xc)
    moreover have "finite (H <#> F)" using set_mult_finite[OF assms(3) i(1) carr(1)] i(4) by blast
    moreover have "H <#> F = (â‹ƒaâˆˆF. (H #> a))"
      unfolding set_mult_def using r_coset_def[of G H] by auto
    ultimately have "card(H #> x) + card(â‹ƒyâˆˆF. (H #> y))
                   = card((H #> x) âˆª (â‹ƒyâˆˆF. (H #> y))) + card((H #> x) âˆ© (â‹ƒyâˆˆF. (H #> y)))"
      using card_Un_Int by auto
    then have "card(H #> x) + card(â‹ƒyâˆˆF. (H #> y)) = card((H #> x) âˆª (â‹ƒyâˆˆF. (H #> y)))"
      using i(5) em by simp
    moreover have "card (H #> x) = card H"
      using card_rcosets_equal[of _ H] rcosetsI[of H] carr(1) xc by metis
    moreover have "card (insert x F) * card H = card F * card H + card H"
      by (simp add: i)
    ultimately show ?case using cF by simp
  qed
  moreover have "H <#> J = (â‹ƒaâˆˆJ. (H #> a))"
    unfolding set_mult_def using r_coset_def[of G H] by auto
  ultimately show "card (H <#> J) = card J * card H" by argo
qed

lemma (in comm_group) finite_sub_comp_iff_card_eq_mult:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "finite H" "finite J"
  shows "card (H <#> J) = card J * card H  âŸ· complementary H J"
  using finite_sub_comp_imp_card_eq_mult[OF assms] finite_sub_card_eq_mult_imp_comp[OF assms]
  by blast

subsection â€¹â€¹IDirProdâ€º - binary internal direct productâ€º

text â€¹We introduce the internal direct product formed by two subgroups (so in its binary form).â€º

definition IDirProd :: "('a, 'b) monoid_scheme â‡’ 'a set â‡’ 'a set â‡’ 'a set" where
  "IDirProd G Y Z = generate G (Y âˆª Z)"

text â€¹Some trivial lemmas about the binary internal direct product.â€º

lemma (in group) IDirProd_comm:
  "IDirProd G A B = IDirProd G B A"
  unfolding IDirProd_def by (simp add: sup_commute)

lemma (in group) IDirProd_empty_right:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "IDirProd G A {} = generate G A"
  unfolding IDirProd_def by simp

lemma (in group) IDirProd_empty_left:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "IDirProd G {} A = generate G A"
  unfolding IDirProd_def by simp

lemma (in group) IDirProd_one_right:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "IDirProd G A {ğŸ­} = generate G A"
  unfolding IDirProd_def
proof
  interpret sA: subgroup "(generate G A)" G using assms generate_is_subgroup by simp
  interpret sAone: subgroup "(generate G (A âˆª {ğŸ­}))" G using assms generate_is_subgroup by simp
  show "generate G (A âˆª {ğŸ­}) âŠ† generate G A"
    using generate_subgroup_incl[of "A âˆª {ğŸ­}" "generate G A"]
          generate.incl assms sA.one_closed sA.subgroup_axioms by fast
  show "generate G A âŠ† generate G (A âˆª {ğŸ­})"
    using mono_generate[of A "A âˆª {ğŸ­}"] by blast
qed

lemma (in group) IDirProd_one_left:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "IDirProd G {ğŸ­} A = generate G A"
  using IDirProd_one_right[of A] assms unfolding IDirProd_def by force

lemma (in group) IDirProd_is_subgroup:
  assumes "Y âŠ† carrier G" "Z âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "subgroup (IDirProd G Y Z) G"
  unfolding IDirProd_def using generate_is_subgroup[of "Y âˆª Z"] assms by simp


text â€¹Using the theory about set multiplication we can also show the connection of the underlying
set in the internal direct product with the set multiplication in the case of an abelian group.
Together with the facts about complementarity and the set multiplication we can characterize
complementarity by the cardinality of the internal direct product and vice versa.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) IDirProd_eq_subgroup_mult:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G"
  shows "IDirProd G H J = H <#> J"
  unfolding IDirProd_def
  by (rule set_mult_eq_generate_subgroup[OF assms])

lemma (in comm_group) finite_sub_comp_iff_card_eq_IDirProd:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "subgroup J G" "finite H" "finite J"
  shows "card (IDirProd G H J) = card J * card H  âŸ· complementary H J"
  using finite_sub_comp_iff_card_eq_mult IDirProd_eq_subgroup_mult assms by presburger

subsection â€¹â€¹IDirProdsâ€º - indexed internal direct productâ€º

text â€¹The indexed version of the internal direct product acting on a family of subgroups.â€º

definition IDirProds :: "('a, 'b) monoid_scheme â‡’ ('c â‡’ 'a set) â‡’ 'c set â‡’ 'a set" where
  "IDirProds G S I = generate G (â‹ƒ(S ` I))"

text â€¹Lemmas about the indexed internal direct product.â€º

lemma (in group) IDirProds_incl:
  assumes "i âˆˆ I"
  shows "S i âŠ† IDirProds G S I"
  unfolding IDirProds_def using assms generate.incl[of _ "â‹ƒ(S ` I)" G] by blast

lemma (in group) IDirProds_empty:
  "IDirProds G S {} = {ğŸ­}"
  unfolding IDirProds_def using generate_empty by simp

lemma (in group) IDirProds_is_subgroup:
  assumes "â‹ƒ(S ` I) âŠ† (carrier G)"
  shows "subgroup (IDirProds G S I) G"
  unfolding IDirProds_def using generate_is_subgroup[of "â‹ƒ(S ` I)"] assms by auto

lemma (in group) IDirProds_subgroup_id: "subgroup (S i) G âŸ¹ IDirProds G S {i} = S i"
  by (simp add: generate_subgroup_id IDirProds_def)

lemma (in comm_group) IDirProds_Un:
  assumes "âˆ€iâˆˆA. subgroup (S i) G" "âˆ€jâˆˆB. subgroup (S j) G"
  shows   "IDirProds G S (A âˆª B) = IDirProds G S A <#> IDirProds G S B"
proof -
  have subset: "â‹ƒ (S ` A) âŠ† carrier G" "â‹ƒ (S ` B) âŠ† carrier G"
    using subgroup.subset assms(1, 2) by blast+
  have "IDirProds G S A <#> IDirProds G S B = IDirProd G (IDirProds G S A) (IDirProds G S B)"
    using assms by (intro IDirProd_eq_subgroup_mult [symmetric] IDirProds_is_subgroup subset)
  also have "â€¦ = generate G (â‹ƒ (S ` A) âˆª IDirProds G S B)"
    unfolding IDirProds_def IDirProd_def by (intro generate_idem' generate_incl subset)
  also have "â€¦ = generate G (â‹ƒ(S ` A) âˆª â‹ƒ(S ` B))"
    unfolding IDirProds_def IDirProd_def
    by (intro generate_idem'_right generate_incl subset)
  also have "â‹ƒ(S ` A) âˆª â‹ƒ(S ` B) = â‹ƒ(S ` (A âˆª B))"
    by blast
  also have "generate G â€¦ = IDirProds G S (A âˆª B)"
    unfolding IDirProds_def ..
  finally show ?thesis ..
qed

lemma (in comm_group) IDirProds_finite:
  assumes "finite I" "âˆ€iâˆˆI. subgroup (S i) G" "âˆ€iâˆˆI. finite (S i)"
  shows "finite (IDirProds G S I)" using assms
proof (induction I rule: finite_induct)
  case empty
  thus ?case using IDirProds_empty[of S] by simp
next
  case i: (insert x I)
  interpret Sx: subgroup "S x" G using i by blast
  have cx: "(S x) âŠ† carrier G" by force
  have cI: "â‹ƒ(S ` I) âŠ† carrier G" using i subgroup.subset by blast
  interpret subgroup "IDirProds G S I" G using IDirProds_is_subgroup[OF cI] .
  have cIP: "(IDirProds G S I) âŠ† carrier G" by force
  from i have f: "finite (S x)" "finite (IDirProds G S I)" "finite {x}" by blast+
  from IDirProds_Un[of "{x}" S I]
  have "IDirProds G S ({x} âˆª I) = IDirProds G S {x} <#> IDirProds G S I" using i by blast
  also have "â€¦ = S x <#> IDirProds G S I"
    using IDirProds_subgroup_id[of S x] Sx.subgroup_axioms by force
  also have "finite (â€¦)" using set_mult_finite[OF f(1, 2) cx cIP] .
  finally show ?case unfolding insert_def by simp
qed

lemma (in comm_group) IDirProds_compl_imp_compl:
  assumes "âˆ€i âˆˆ I. subgroup (S i) G" and "subgroup H G"
  assumes "complementary H (IDirProds G S I)" "i âˆˆ I"
  shows   "complementary H (S i)"
proof -
  have "S i âŠ† IDirProds G S I" using assms IDirProds_incl by fast
  then have "H âˆ© (S i) âŠ† H âˆ© IDirProds G S I" by blast
  moreover have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ H âˆ© (S i)" using subgroup.one_closed assms by auto
  ultimately show "complementary H (S i)" using assms(3) unfolding complementary_def by blast
qed

text â€¹Using the knowledge about the binary internal direct product, we can - in case that all
subgroups in the family have coprime orders - also derive the cardinality of the indexed internal
direct product.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) IDirProds_card:
  assumes "finite I" "âˆ€iâˆˆI. subgroup (S i) G"
          "âˆ€iâˆˆI. finite (S i)" "pairwise (Î»x y. coprime (card (S x)) (card (S y))) I"
  shows "card (IDirProds G S I) = (âˆi âˆˆ I. card (S i))" using assms
proof (induction I rule: finite_induct)
  case empty
  then show ?case using IDirProds_empty[of S] by simp
next
  case i: (insert x I)
  have sx: "subgroup (S x) G" using i(4) by blast
  have cx: "(S x) âŠ† carrier G" using subgroup.subset[OF sx] .
  have fx: "finite (S x)" using i by blast
  have cI: "â‹ƒ(S ` I) âŠ† carrier G" using subgroup.subset[of _ G] i(4) by blast
  from generate_is_subgroup[OF this] have sIP: "subgroup (IDirProds G S I) G"
    unfolding IDirProds_def .
  then have cIP: "(IDirProds G S I) âŠ† carrier G" using subgroup.subset by blast
  have fIP: "finite (IDirProds G S I)" using IDirProds_finite[OF i(1)] i by blast

  from i have ih: "card (IDirProds G S I) = (âˆiâˆˆI. card (S i))" unfolding pairwise_def by blast
  hence cop: "coprime (card (IDirProds G S I)) (card (S x))"
  proof -
    have cFI0: "card (IDirProds G S I) â‰  0" using finite_subgroup_card_neq_0[OF sIP fIP] .
    moreover have cx0: "card (S x) â‰  0" using finite_subgroup_card_neq_0[OF sx fx] .
    moreover have  "prime_factors (card (IDirProds G S I)) âˆ© prime_factors (card (S x)) = {}"
    proof (rule ccontr)
      have n0: "â‹€i. i âˆˆ I âŸ¹ card (S i) â‰  0" using finite_subgroup_card_neq_0 i(4, 5) by blast
      assume "prime_factors (card (IDirProds G S I)) âˆ© prime_factors (card (S x)) â‰  {}"
      moreover have "prime_factors (card (IDirProds G S I)) = â‹ƒ(prime_factors ` (card âˆ˜ S) ` I)"
        using n0 prime_factors_Prod[OF i(1), of "card âˆ˜ S"] by (subst ih; simp)
      moreover have "â‹€i. i âˆˆ I âŸ¹ prime_factors (card (S i)) âˆ© prime_factors (card (S x)) = {}"
      proof -
        fix i
        assume ind: "i âˆˆ I"
        then have coPx: "coprime (card (S i)) (card (S x))"
          using i(2, 6) unfolding pairwise_def by auto
        have "card (S i) â‰  0" using n0 ind by blast
        from coprime_eq_empty_prime_inter[OF this cx0]
        show "prime_factors (card (S i)) âˆ© prime_factors (card (S x)) = {}" using coPx by blast
      qed
      ultimately show "False" by auto
    qed
    ultimately show ?thesis using coprime_eq_empty_prime_inter by blast
  qed
  have "card (IDirProds G S (insert x I)) = card (S x) * card (IDirProds G S I)"
  proof -
    from finite_sub_comp_iff_card_eq_IDirProd[OF sIP sx fIP fx]
         subgroups_card_coprime_imp_compl[OF sIP sx cop]
    have "card (IDirProd G (IDirProds G S I) (S x)) = card (S x) * card (IDirProds G S I)" by blast
    moreover have "generate G (â‹ƒ (S ` insert x I)) = generate G (generate G (â‹ƒ (S ` I)) âˆª S x)"
      by (simp add: Un_commute cI cx generate_idem'_right)
    ultimately show ?thesis unfolding IDirProds_def IDirProd_def by argo
  qed
  also have "â€¦ = card (S x) * prod (card âˆ˜ S) I" using ih by simp
  also have "â€¦ = prod (card âˆ˜ S) ({x} âˆª I)" using i.hyps by auto
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

subsection "Complementary family of subgroups"

text â€¹The notion of a complementary family is introduced. Note that the subgroups are complementary
not only to the other subgroups but to the product of the other subgroups.â€º

definition (in group) compl_fam :: "('c â‡’ 'a set) â‡’ 'c set â‡’ bool" where
  "compl_fam S I = (âˆ€i âˆˆ I. complementary (S i) (IDirProds G S (I - {i})))"

text â€¹Some lemmas about â€¹compl_famâ€º.â€º

lemma (in group) compl_fam_empty[simp]: "compl_fam S {}"
  unfolding compl_fam_def by simp

lemma (in group) compl_fam_cong:
  assumes "compl_fam (f âˆ˜ g) A" "inj_on g A"
  shows "compl_fam f (g ` A)"
proof -
  have "((f âˆ˜ g) ` (A - {i})) =  (f ` (g ` A - {g i}))" if "i âˆˆ A" for i
    using assms that unfolding inj_on_def comp_def by blast
  thus ?thesis using assms unfolding compl_fam_def IDirProds_def complementary_def by simp
qed

text â€¹We now connect â€¹compl_famâ€º with â€¹generateâ€º as this will be its main application.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) compl_fam_imp_generate_inj:
  assumes "gs âŠ† carrier G" "compl_fam (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs"
  shows "inj_on (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs"
proof(rule, rule ccontr)
  fix x y
  assume xy: "x âˆˆ gs" "y âˆˆ gs" "x â‰  y"
  have gen: "generate G (â‹ƒgâˆˆgs - {y}. generate G {g}) = generate G (gs - {y})"
    by (intro generate_idem_Un, use assms in blast)
  assume g: "generate G {x} = generate G {y}"
  with xy have "generate G {y} âŠ† generate G (gs - {y})" using mono_generate[of "{x}" "gs - {y}"] by auto
  with xy have gyo: "generate G {y} = {ğŸ­}" using assms(2) generate.one gen
    unfolding compl_fam_def complementary_def IDirProds_def by blast
  hence yo: "y = ğŸ­" using generate_singleton_one by simp
  from gyo g generate_singleton_one have xo: "x = ğŸ­" by simp
  from xy yo xo show False by blast
qed  

lemma (in comm_group) compl_fam_generate_subset:
  assumes "compl_fam (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs"
          "gs âŠ† carrier G" "A âŠ† gs"
  shows "compl_fam (Î»g. generate G {g}) A"
proof(unfold compl_fam_def complementary_def IDirProds_def, subst generate_idem_Un)
  show "â‹€i. A - {i} âŠ† carrier G" using assms by blast
  have "generate G {i} âˆ© generate G (A - {i}) = {ğŸ­}" if "i âˆˆ A" for i
  proof -
    have "ğŸ­ âˆˆ generate G {i} âˆ© generate G (A - {i})" using generate.one by blast
    moreover have "generate G (A - {i}) âŠ† generate G (gs - {i})"
      by (intro mono_generate, use assms in fast)
    moreover have "generate G {i} âˆ© generate G (gs - {i}) = {ğŸ­}"
      using assms that generate_idem_Un[of "gs - {i}"]
      unfolding compl_fam_def IDirProds_def complementary_def by blast
    ultimately show ?thesis by blast
  qed
  thus "âˆ€iâˆˆA. generate G {i} âˆ© generate G (A - {i}) = {ğŸ­}" by auto
qed

subsection â€¹â€¹is_idirprodâ€ºâ€º

text â€¹In order to identify a group as the internal direct product of a family of subgroups, they all
have to be normal subgroups, complementary to the product of the rest of the subgroups and generate
all of the group - this is captured in the definition of â€¹is_idirprodâ€º.â€º

definition (in group) is_idirprod :: "'a set â‡’ ('c â‡’ 'a set) â‡’ 'c set â‡’ bool" where
  "is_idirprod A S I = ((âˆ€i âˆˆ I. S i âŠ² G) âˆ§ A = IDirProds G S I âˆ§ compl_fam S I)"

text â€¹Very basic lemmas about â€¹is_idirprodâ€º.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) is_idirprod_subgroup_suffices:
  assumes "A = IDirProds G S I" "âˆ€iâˆˆI. subgroup (S i) G" "compl_fam S I"
  shows "is_idirprod A S I"
  unfolding is_idirprod_def using assms subgroup_imp_normal by blast

lemma (in comm_group) is_idirprod_generate:
  assumes "A = generate G gs" "gs âŠ† carrier G" "compl_fam (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs"
  shows "is_idirprod A (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs"
proof(intro is_idirprod_subgroup_suffices)
  show "A = IDirProds G (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs"
    using assms generate_idem_Un[OF assms(2)] unfolding IDirProds_def by argo
  show "âˆ€iâˆˆgs. subgroup (generate G {i}) G" using assms generate_is_subgroup by auto
  show "compl_fam (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs" by fact
qed

lemma (in comm_group) is_idirprod_imp_compl_fam[simp]:
  assumes "is_idirprod A S I"
  shows "compl_fam S I"
  using assms unfolding is_idirprod_def by blast

lemma (in comm_group) is_idirprod_generate_imp_generate[simp]:
  assumes "is_idirprod A (Î»g. generate G {g}) gs"
  shows "A = generate G gs"
proof -
  have "gs âŠ† carrier G"
  proof
    show "g âˆˆ carrier G" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g
    proof -
      interpret g: subgroup "generate G {g}" G
        using assms that normal_imp_subgroup unfolding is_idirprod_def by blast
      show ?thesis using g.subset generate.incl by fast
    qed
  qed
  thus ?thesis using assms generate_idem_Un unfolding is_idirprod_def IDirProds_def by presburger
qed

end

Theory Finite_Product_Extend

(*
    File:     Finite_Product_Extend.thy
    Author:   Joseph Thommes, TU MÃ¼nchen; Manuel Eberl, TU MÃ¼nchen
*)
section â€¹Finite Productâ€º

theory Finite_Product_Extend
  imports IDirProds
begin

text â€¹In this section, some general facts about â€¹finprodâ€º as well as some tailored for the rest of
this entry are proven.â€º

text â€¹It is often needed to split a product in a single factor and the rest. Thus these two lemmas.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_minus:
  assumes "a âˆˆ A" "f âˆˆ A â†’ carrier G" "finite A"
  shows "finprod G f A = f a âŠ— finprod G f (A - {a})"
proof -
  from assms have "A = insert a (A - {a})" by blast
  then have "finprod G f A = finprod G f (insert a (A - {a}))" by simp
  also have "â€¦ = f a âŠ— finprod G f (A - {a})" using assms by (intro finprod_insert, auto)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_minus_symm:
  assumes "a âˆˆ A" "f âˆˆ A â†’ carrier G" "finite A"
  shows "finprod G f A = finprod G f (A - {a}) âŠ— f a"
proof -
  from assms have "A = insert a (A - {a})" by blast
  then have "finprod G f A = finprod G f (insert a (A - {a}))" by simp
  also have "â€¦ = f a âŠ— finprod G f (A - {a})" using assms by (intro finprod_insert, auto)
  also have "â€¦ = finprod G f (A - {a}) âŠ— f a"
    by (intro m_comm, use assms in blast, intro finprod_closed, use assms in blast)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

text â€¹This makes it very easy to show the following trivial fact.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_singleton:
  assumes "f x âˆˆ carrier G" "finprod G f {x} = a"
  shows "f x = a"
proof -
  have "finprod G f {x} = f x âŠ— finprod G f {}" using finprod_minus[of x "{x}" f] assms by auto
  thus ?thesis using assms by simp
qed

text â€¹The finite product is consistent and closed concerning subgroups.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_subgroup:
  assumes "f âˆˆ S â†’ H" "subgroup H G"
  shows "finprod G f S = finprod (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) f S"
proof (cases "finite S")
  case True
  interpret H: comm_group "Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ" using subgroup_is_comm_group[OF assms(2)] .
  show ?thesis using True assms
  proof (induction S rule: finite_induct)
    case empty
    then show ?case using finprod_empty H.finprod_empty by simp
  next
    case i: (insert x F)
    then have "finprod G f F = finprod (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) f F" by blast
    moreover have "finprod G f (insert x F) = f x âŠ— finprod G f F"
    proof(intro finprod_insert[OF i(1, 2), of f])
      show "f âˆˆ F â†’ carrier G" "f x âˆˆ carrier G" using i(4) subgroup.subset[OF i(5)] by blast+
    qed
    ultimately have "finprod G f (insert x F) = f x âŠ—â‡˜Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆâ‡™ finprod (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) f F"
      by auto
    moreover have "finprod (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ) f (insert x F) = â€¦"
    proof(intro H.finprod_insert[OF i(1, 2)])
      show "f âˆˆ F â†’ carrier (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" "f x âˆˆ carrier (Gâ¦‡carrier := Hâ¦ˆ)" using i(4) by auto
    qed
    ultimately show ?case by simp
  qed
next
  case False
  then show ?thesis unfolding finprod_def by simp
qed

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_closed_subgroup:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "f âˆˆ A â†’ H"
  shows "finprod G f A âˆˆ H"
  using assms(2)
proof (induct A rule: infinite_finite_induct)
case (infinite A)
then show ?case using subgroup.one_closed[OF assms(1)] by auto
next
  case empty
  then show ?case using subgroup.one_closed[OF assms(1)] by auto
next
  case i: (insert x F)
  from finprod_insert[OF i(1, 2), of f] i have fi: "finprod G f (insert x F) = f x âŠ— finprod G f F"
    using subgroup.subset[OF assms(1)] by blast
  from i have "finprod G f F âˆˆ H" "f x âˆˆ H" by blast+
  with fi show ?case using subgroup.m_closed[OF assms(1)] by presburger 
qed

text â€¹It also does not matter if we exponentiate all elements taking part in the product or the
result of the product.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_exp:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "f âˆˆ A â†’ carrier G"
  shows "(finprod G f A) [^] (k::int) = finprod G ((Î»a. a [^] k) âˆ˜ f) A"
  using assms
proof(induction A rule: infinite_finite_induct)
  case i: (insert x F)
  hence ih: "finprod G f F [^] k = finprod G ((Î»a. a [^] k) âˆ˜ f) F" by blast
  have fpc: "finprod G f F âˆˆ carrier G" by (intro finprod_closed, use i in auto)
  have fxc: "f x âˆˆ carrier G" using i by auto
  have "finprod G f (insert x F) = f x âŠ— finprod G f F" by (intro finprod_insert, use i in auto)
  hence "finprod G f (insert x F) [^] k = (f x âŠ— finprod G f F) [^] k" by simp
  also have "â€¦ = f x [^] k âŠ— finprod G f F [^] k" using fpc fxc int_pow_distrib by blast
  also have "â€¦ = ((Î»a. a [^] k) âˆ˜ f) x âŠ— finprod G ((Î»a. a [^] k) âˆ˜ f) F" using ih by simp
  also have "â€¦ = finprod G ((Î»a. a [^] k) âˆ˜ f) (insert x F)"
    by (intro finprod_insert[symmetric], use i in auto)
  finally show ?case .
qed auto

text â€¹Some lemmas concerning different combinations of functions in the usage of â€¹finprodâ€º.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_cong_split:
  assumes "â‹€a. a âˆˆ A âŸ¹ f a âŠ— g a = h a"
  and "f âˆˆ A â†’ carrier G" "g âˆˆ A â†’ carrier G" "h âˆˆ A â†’ carrier G"
  shows "finprod G h A = finprod G f A âŠ— finprod G g A" using assms
proof(induct A rule: infinite_finite_induct)
  case (infinite A)
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case empty
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case i: (insert x F)
  then have iH: "finprod G h F = finprod G f F âŠ— finprod G g F" by fast
  have f: "finprod G f (insert x F) = f x âŠ— finprod G f F"
    by (intro finprod_insert[OF i(1, 2), of f]; use i(5) in simp)
  have g: "finprod G g (insert x F) = g x âŠ— finprod G g F"
    by (intro finprod_insert[OF i(1, 2), of g]; use i(6) in simp)
  have h: "finprod G h (insert x F) = h x âŠ— finprod G h F"
    by (intro finprod_insert[OF i(1, 2), of h]; use i(7) in simp)  
  also have "â€¦ = h x âŠ— (finprod G f F âŠ— finprod G g F)" using iH by argo
  also have "â€¦ = f x âŠ— g x âŠ— (finprod G f F âŠ— finprod G g F)" using i(4) by simp
  also have "â€¦ = f x âŠ— finprod G f F âŠ— (g x âŠ— finprod G g F)" using m_comm m_assoc i(5-7) by simp
  also have "â€¦ = finprod G f (insert x F) âŠ— finprod G g (insert x F)" using f g by argo
  finally show ?case .
qed

lemma (in comm_group) finprod_comp:
  assumes "inj_on g A" "(f âˆ˜ g) ` A âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "finprod G f (g ` A) = finprod G (f âˆ˜ g) A"
  using finprod_reindex[OF _ assms(1), of f] using assms(2) unfolding comp_def by blast

text â€¹The subgroup generated by a set of generators (in an abelian group) is exactly the set of
elements that can be written as a finite product using only powers of these elements.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) generate_eq_finprod_PiE_image:
  assumes "finite gs" "gs âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G gs = (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a})" (is "?g = ?fp")
proof
  show "?g âŠ† ?fp"
  proof
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ ?g"
    thus "x âˆˆ ?fp"
    proof (induction rule: generate.induct)
      case one
      show ?case
      proof
        let ?r = "restrict (Î»_. ğŸ­) gs"
        show "?r âˆˆ (Î â‡©E aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" using generate.one by auto
        show "ğŸ­ = finprod G ?r gs" by(intro finprod_one_eqI[symmetric], simp)
      qed
    next
      case g: (incl g)
      show ?case
      proof
        let ?r = "restrict ((Î»_. ğŸ­)(g := g)) gs"
        show "?r âˆˆ (Î â‡©E aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" using generate.one generate.incl[of g "{g}" G]
          by fastforce
        show "g = finprod G ?r gs"
        proof -
          have "finprod G ?r gs = ?r g âŠ— finprod G ?r (gs - {g})"
            by (intro finprod_minus, use assms g in auto)
          moreover have "?r g = g" using g by simp
          moreover have "finprod G ?r (gs - {g}) = ğŸ­" by(rule finprod_one_eqI; use g in simp)
          ultimately show ?thesis using assms g by auto
        qed
      qed
    next
      case g: (inv g)
      show ?case
      proof
        let ?r = "restrict ((Î»_. ğŸ­)(g := inv g)) gs"
        show "?r âˆˆ (Î â‡©E aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" using generate.one generate.inv[of g "{g}" G]
          by fastforce
        show "inv g = finprod G ?r gs"
        proof -
          have "finprod G ?r gs = ?r g âŠ— finprod G ?r (gs - {g})"
            by (intro finprod_minus, use assms g in auto)
          moreover have "?r g = inv g" using g by simp
          moreover have "finprod G ?r (gs - {g}) = ğŸ­" by(rule finprod_one_eqI; use g in simp)
          ultimately show ?thesis using assms g by auto
        qed
      qed
    next
      case gh: (eng g h)
      from gh obtain i where i: "i âˆˆ (Î â‡©E aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" "g = finprod G i gs" by blast
      from gh obtain j where j: "j âˆˆ (Î â‡©E aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" "h = finprod G j gs" by blast
      from i j have "g âŠ— h = finprod G i gs âŠ— finprod G j gs" by blast
      also have "â€¦ = finprod G (Î»a. i a âŠ— j a) gs"
      proof(intro finprod_multf[symmetric]; rule)
        fix x
        assume x: "x âˆˆ gs"
        have "i x âˆˆ generate G {x}" "j x âˆˆ generate G {x}"using i(1) j(1) x by blast+
        thus "i x âˆˆ carrier G" "j x âˆˆ carrier G" using generate_incl[of "{x}"] x assms(2) by blast+
      qed
      also have "â€¦ = finprod G (restrict (Î»a. i a âŠ— j a) gs) gs"
      proof(intro finprod_cong)
        have ip: "i g âˆˆ generate G {g}" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g using i that by auto
        have jp: "j g âˆˆ generate G {g}" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g using j that by auto
        have "i g âŠ— j g âˆˆ generate G {g}" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g
          using generate.eng[OF ip[OF that] jp[OF that]] .
        thus "((Î»a. i a âŠ— j a) âˆˆ gs â†’ carrier G) = True" using generate_incl assms(2) by blast
      qed auto
      finally have "g âŠ— h = finprod G (restrict (Î»a. i a âŠ— j a) gs) gs" .
      moreover have "(restrict (Î»a. i a âŠ— j a) gs) âˆˆ (Î â‡©E aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})"
      proof -
        have ip: "i g âˆˆ generate G {g}" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g using i that by auto
        have jp: "j g âˆˆ generate G {g}" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g using j that by auto
        have "i g âŠ— j g âˆˆ generate G {g}" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g
          using generate.eng[OF ip[OF that] jp[OF that]] .
        thus ?thesis by auto
      qed
      ultimately show ?case using i j by blast
    qed
  qed
  show "?fp âŠ† ?g"
  proof
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ ?fp"
    then obtain f where f: "f âˆˆ (Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a}))" "x = finprod G f gs" by blast
    have sg: "subgroup ?g G" by(intro generate_is_subgroup, fact)
    have "finprod G f gs âˆˆ ?g"
    proof(intro finprod_closed_subgroup[OF sg])
      have "f g âˆˆ generate G gs" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g
      proof -
        have "f g âˆˆ generate G {g}" using f(1) that by auto
        moreover have "generate G {g} âŠ† generate G gs" by(intro mono_generate, use that in simp)
        ultimately show ?thesis by fast
      qed
      thus "f âˆˆ gs â†’ generate G gs" by simp
    qed
    thus "x âˆˆ ?g" using f by blast
  qed
qed

lemma (in comm_group) generate_eq_finprod_Pi_image:
  assumes "finite gs" "gs âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G gs = (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Pi gs (Î»a. generate G {a})" (is "?g = ?fp")
proof -
  have "(Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a})
      = (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Pi gs (Î»a. generate G {a})"
  proof
    have "Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a}) âŠ† Pi gs (Î»a. generate G {a})" by blast
    thus "(Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a})
        âŠ† (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Pi gs (Î»a. generate G {a})" by blast
    show "(Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Pi gs (Î»a. generate G {a})
        âŠ† (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a})"
    proof
      fix x
      assume x: "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Pi gs (Î»a. generate G {a})"
      then obtain f where f: "x = finprod G f gs" "f âˆˆ Pi gs (Î»a. generate G {a})" by blast
      moreover have "finprod G f gs = finprod G (restrict f gs) gs"
      proof(intro finprod_cong)
        have "f g âˆˆ carrier G" if "g âˆˆ gs" for g
          using that f(2) mono_generate[of "{g}" gs] generate_incl[OF assms(2)] by fast
        thus "(f âˆˆ gs â†’ carrier G) = True" by blast
      qed auto        
      moreover have "restrict f gs âˆˆ Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a})" using f(2) by simp
      ultimately show "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` Piâ‡©E gs (Î»a. generate G {a})" by blast
    qed
  qed
  with generate_eq_finprod_PiE_image[OF assms] show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma (in comm_group) generate_eq_finprod_Pi_int_image:
  assumes "finite gs" "gs âŠ† carrier G"
  shows "generate G gs = (Î»x. finprod G (Î»g. g [^] x g) gs) ` Pi gs (Î»_. (UNIV::int set))"
proof -
  from generate_eq_finprod_Pi_image[OF assms]
  have "generate G gs = (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` (Î  aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" .
  also have "â€¦ = (Î»x. finprod G (Î»g. g [^] x g) gs) ` Pi gs (Î»_. (UNIV::int set))"
  proof(rule; rule)
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` (Î  aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})"
    then obtain f where f: "f âˆˆ (Î  aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" "x = finprod G f gs" by blast
    hence "âˆƒk::int. f a = a [^] k" if "a âˆˆ gs" for a using generate_pow[of a] that assms(2) by blast
    hence "âˆƒ(h::'a â‡’ int). âˆ€aâˆˆgs. f a = a [^] h a" by meson
    then obtain h where h: "âˆ€aâˆˆgs. f a = a [^] h a" "h âˆˆ gs â†’ (UNIV :: int set)" by auto
    have "finprod G (Î»g. g [^] h g) gs = finprod G f gs"
      by (intro finprod_cong, use int_pow_closed h assms(2) in auto)
    with f have "x = finprod G (Î»g. g [^] h g) gs" by argo
    with h(2) show "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G (Î»g. g [^] x g) gs) ` (gs â†’ (UNIV::int set))" by auto
  next
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G (Î»g. g [^] x g) gs) ` (gs â†’ (UNIV::int set))"
    then obtain h where h: "x = finprod G (Î»g. g [^] h g) gs" "h âˆˆ gs â†’ (UNIV :: int set)" by blast
    hence "âˆƒkâˆˆgenerate G {a}. a [^] h a = k" if "a âˆˆ gs" for a
      using generate_pow[of a] that assms(2) by blast
    then obtain f where f: "âˆ€aâˆˆgs. a [^] h a = f a" "f âˆˆ (Î  aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" by fast
    have "finprod G f gs = finprod G (Î»g. g [^] h g) gs"
    proof(intro finprod_cong)
      have "f a âˆˆ carrier G" if "a âˆˆ gs" for a
        using generate_incl[of "{a}"] assms(2) that f(2) by fast
      thus "(f âˆˆ gs â†’ carrier G) = True" by blast
    qed (use f in auto)
    with h have "x = finprod G f gs" by argo
    with f(2) show "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G x gs) ` (Î  aâˆˆgs. generate G {a})" by blast
  qed
  finally show ?thesis .
qed


lemma (in comm_group) IDirProds_eq_finprod_PiE:
  assumes "finite I" "â‹€i. i âˆˆ I âŸ¹ subgroup (S i) G"
  shows "IDirProds G S I = (Î»x. finprod G x I) ` (Piâ‡©E I S)" (is "?DP = ?fp")
proof
  show "?fp âŠ† ?DP"
  proof
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ ?fp"
    then obtain f where f: "f âˆˆ (Piâ‡©E I S)" "x = finprod G f I" by blast
    have sDP: "subgroup ?DP G"
      by (intro IDirProds_is_subgroup; use subgroup.subset[OF assms(2)] in blast)
    have "finprod G f I âˆˆ ?DP"
    proof(intro finprod_closed_subgroup[OF sDP])
      have "f i âˆˆ IDirProds G S I" if "i âˆˆ I" for i
      proof
        show "f i âˆˆ (S i)" using f(1) that by auto
        show "(S i) âŠ† IDirProds G S I" by (intro IDirProds_incl[OF that])
      qed
      thus "f âˆˆ I â†’ IDirProds G S I" by simp
    qed
    thus "x âˆˆ ?DP" using f by blast
  qed
  show "?DP âŠ† ?fp"
  proof(unfold IDirProds_def; rule subsetI)
    fix x
    assume x: "x âˆˆ generate G (â‹ƒ(S ` I))"
    thus "x âˆˆ ?fp" using assms
    proof (induction rule: generate.induct)
      case one
      define g where g: "g = (Î»x. if x âˆˆ I then ğŸ­ else undefined)"
      then have "g âˆˆ Piâ‡©E I S"
        using subgroup.one_closed[OF one(2)] by auto
      moreover have "finprod G g I = ğŸ­" by (intro finprod_one_eqI; use g in simp)
      ultimately show ?case unfolding image_def by (auto; metis)
    next
      case i: (incl h)
      from i obtain j where j: "j âˆˆ I" "h âˆˆ (S j)" by blast
      define hf where "hf = (Î»x. (if x âˆˆ I then ğŸ­ else undefined))(j := h)"
      with j have "hf âˆˆ Piâ‡©E I S"
        using subgroup.one_closed[OF i(3)] by force
      moreover have "finprod G hf I = h"
      proof -
        have "finprod G hf I = hf j âŠ— finprod G hf (I - {j})"
          by (intro finprod_minus, use assms hf_def subgroup.subset[OF i(3)[OF j(1)]] j in auto)
        moreover have "hf j = h" using hf_def by simp
        moreover have "finprod G hf (I - {j}) = ğŸ­" by (rule finprod_one_eqI; use hf_def in simp)
        ultimately show ?thesis using subgroup.subset[OF i(3)[OF j(1)]] j(2) by auto
      qed
      ultimately show ?case unfolding image_def by (auto; metis)
    next
      case i: (inv h)
      from i obtain j where j: "j âˆˆ I" "h âˆˆ (S j)" by blast
      have ih: "inv h âˆˆ (S j)" using subgroup.m_inv_closed[OF i(3)[OF j(1)] j(2)] .
      define hf where "hf = (Î»x. (if x âˆˆ I then ğŸ­ else undefined))(j := inv h)"
      with j ih have "hf âˆˆ Piâ‡©E I S"
        using subgroup.one_closed[OF i(3)] by force
      moreover have "finprod G hf I = inv h"
      proof -
        have "finprod G hf I = hf j âŠ— finprod G hf (I - {j})"
          by (intro finprod_minus, use assms hf_def subgroup.subset[OF i(3)[OF j(1)]] j in auto)
        moreover have "hf j = inv h" using hf_def by simp
        moreover have "finprod G hf (I - {j}) = ğŸ­" by (rule finprod_one_eqI; use hf_def in simp)
        ultimately show ?thesis using subgroup.subset[OF i(3)[OF j(1)]] j(2) by auto
      qed
      ultimately show ?case unfolding image_def by (auto; metis)
    next
      case e: (eng a b)
      from e obtain f where f: "f âˆˆ Piâ‡©E I S" "a = finprod G f I" by blast
      from e obtain g where g: "g âˆˆ Piâ‡©E I S" "b = finprod G g I" by blast
      from f g have "a âŠ— b = finprod G f I âŠ— finprod G g I" by blast
      also have "â€¦ = finprod G (Î»a. f a âŠ— g a) I"
      proof(intro finprod_multf[symmetric])
        have "â‹ƒ(S ` I) âŠ† carrier G" using subgroup.subset[OF e(6)] by blast
        thus "f âˆˆ I â†’ carrier G" "g âˆˆ I â†’ carrier G"
          using f(1) g(1) unfolding PiE_def Pi_def by auto
      qed
      also have "â€¦ = finprod G (restrict (Î»a. f a âŠ— g a) I) I"
      proof(intro finprod_cong)
        show "I = I" by simp
        show "â‹€i. i âˆˆ I =simp=> f i âŠ— g i = (Î»aâˆˆI. f a âŠ— g a) i" by simp
        have fp: "f i âˆˆ (S i)" if "i âˆˆ I" for i using f that by auto
        have gp: "g i âˆˆ (S i)" if "i âˆˆ I" for i using g that by auto
        have "f i âŠ— g i âˆˆ (S i)" if "i âˆˆ I" for i
          using subgroup.m_closed[OF e(6)[OF that] fp[OF that] gp[OF that]] .
        thus "((Î»a. f a âŠ— g a) âˆˆ I â†’ carrier G) = True" using subgroup.subset[OF e(6)] by auto
      qed
      finally have "a âŠ— b = finprod G (restrict (Î»a. f a âŠ— g a) I) I" .
      moreover have "(restrict (Î»a. f a âŠ— g a) I) âˆˆ Piâ‡©E I S"
      proof -
        have fp: "f i âˆˆ (S i)" if "i âˆˆ I" for i using f that by auto
        have gp: "g i âˆˆ (S i)" if "i âˆˆ I" for i using g that by auto
        have "f i âŠ— g i âˆˆ (S i)" if "i âˆˆ I" for i
          using subgroup.m_closed[OF e(6)[OF that] fp[OF that] gp[OF that]] .
        thus ?thesis by auto
      qed
      ultimately show ?case using f g by blast
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma (in comm_group) IDirProds_eq_finprod_Pi:
  assumes "finite I" "â‹€i. i âˆˆ I âŸ¹ subgroup (S i) G"
  shows "IDirProds G S I = (Î»x. finprod G x I) ` (Pi I S)" (is "?DP = ?fp")
proof -
  have "(Î»x. finprod G x I) ` (Pi I S) = (Î»x. finprod G x I) ` (Piâ‡©E I S)"
  proof
    have "Piâ‡©E I S âŠ† Pi I S" by blast
    thus "(Î»x. finprod G x I) ` Piâ‡©E I S âŠ† (Î»x. finprod G x I) ` Pi I S" by blast
    show "(Î»x. finprod G x I) ` Pi I S âŠ† (Î»x. finprod G x I) ` Piâ‡©E I S"
    proof
      fix x
      assume x: "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G x I) ` Pi I S"
      then obtain f where f: "x = finprod G f I" "f âˆˆ Pi I S" by blast
      moreover have "finprod G f I = finprod G (restrict f I) I"
        by (intro finprod_cong; use f(2) subgroup.subset[OF assms(2)] in fastforce)
      moreover have "restrict f I âˆˆ Piâ‡©E I S" using f(2) by simp
      ultimately show "x âˆˆ (Î»x. finprod G x I) ` Piâ‡©E I S" by blast
    qed
  qed
  with IDirProds_eq_finprod_PiE[OF assms] show ?thesis by auto
qed

text â€¹If we switch one element from a set of generators, the generated set stays the same if both
elements can be generated from the others together with the switched element respectively.â€º

lemma (in comm_group) generate_one_switched_exp_eqI:
  assumes "A âŠ† carrier G" "a âˆˆ A" "B = (A - {a}) âˆª {b}"
  and "f âˆˆ A â†’ (UNIV::int set)" "g âˆˆ B â†’ (UNIV::int set)"
  and "a = finprod G (Î»x. x [^] g x) B" "b = finprod G (Î»x. x [^] f x) A"
  shows "generate G A = generate G B"
proof(intro generate_one_switched_eqI[OF assms(1, 2, 3)]; cases "finite A")
  case True
  hence fB: "finite B" using assms(3) by blast
  have cB: "B âŠ† carrier G"
  proof -
    have "b âˆˆ carrier G"
      by (subst assms(7), intro finprod_closed, use assms(1, 4) int_pow_closed in fast)
    thus ?thesis using assms(1, 3) by blast
  qed
  show "a âˆˆ generate G B"
  proof(subst generate_eq_finprod_Pi_image[OF fB cB], rule)
    show "a = finprod G (Î»x. x [^] g x) B" by fact
    have "x [^] g x âˆˆ generate G {x}" if "x âˆˆ B" for x using generate_pow[of x] cB that by blast
    thus "(Î»x. x [^] g x) âˆˆ (Î  aâˆˆB. generate G {a})" unfolding Pi_def by blast
  qed
  show "b âˆˆ generate G A"
  proof(subst generate_eq_finprod_Pi_image[OF True assms(1)], rule)
    show "b = finprod G (Î»x. x [^] f x) A" by fact
    have "x [^] f x âˆˆ generate G {x}" if "x âˆˆ A" for x
      using generate_pow[of x] assms(1) that by blast
    thus "(Î»x. x [^] f x) âˆˆ (Î  aâˆˆA. generate G {a})" unfolding Pi_def by blast
  qed
next
  case False
  hence b: "b = ğŸ­" using assms(7) unfolding finprod_def by simp
  from False assms(3) have "infinite B" by simp
